trans-unit.source: A database-wide property always has persistence. That is, its value is stored in the database.

seg-source.mrk: A database-wide property always has persistence.
That is, its value is stored in the database.

target.mrk: A database-wide property always has persistence.
That is, its value is stored in the database.

trans-unit.source: Typically, a database-wide property is in effect until you explicitly change the property or until you set a system-wide property with precedence over database-wide properties (see <xref href="cdevsetprop23308.dita#cdevsetprop23308"/>).

seg-source.mrk: Typically, a database-wide property is in effect until you explicitly change the property or until you set a system-wide property with precedence over database-wide properties (see <xref href="cdevsetprop23308.dita#cdevsetprop23308"/>).

target.mrk: Typically, a database-wide property is in effect until you explicitly change the property or until you set a system-wide property with precedence over database-wide properties (see <xref href="cdevsetprop23308.dita#cdevsetprop23308"/>).

trans-unit.source: To disable or turn off a database-wide property setting, set its value to null. This has the effect of removing the property from the list of database properties and restoring the system property setting, if there is one (and if derby.database.propertiesOnly has not been set; see ).

seg-source.mrk: To disable or turn off a database-wide property setting, set its value to null.

This has the effect of removing the property from the list of database properties and restoring the system property setting, if there is one (and if derby.database.propertiesOnly has not been set; see ).

target.mrk: To disable or turn off a database-wide property setting, set its value to null.

This has the effect of removing the property from the list of database properties and restoring the system property setting, if there is one (and if derby.database.propertiesOnly has not been set; see ).

trans-unit.source: A system-wide property might have persistence, depending on how you set it. If you set it programmatically, it persists only for the duration of the JVM of the application that set it. If you set it in the derby.properties file, a property persists until:

seg-source.mrk: A system-wide property might have persistence, depending on how you set it.
If you set it programmatically, it persists only for the duration of the JVM of the application that set it.
If you set it in the derby.properties file, a property persists until:

target.mrk: A system-wide property might have persistence, depending on how you set it.
If you set it programmatically, it persists only for the duration of the JVM of the application that set it.
If you set it in the derby.properties file, a property persists until:

trans-unit.source: That value is changed and the system is rebooted

seg-source.mrk: That value is changed and the system is rebooted

target.mrk: That value is changed and the system is rebooted

trans-unit.source: The file is removed from the system and the system is rebooted

seg-source.mrk: The file is removed from the system and the system is rebooted

target.mrk: The file is removed from the system and the system is rebooted

trans-unit.source: The database is booted outside of that system

seg-source.mrk: The database is booted outside of that system

target.mrk: The database is booted outside of that system
